title: nCoV-2019 sequencing protocol v3 (LoCost)

source.description:
Mix the following components in a PCR strip-tubes/plate. Gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid.
AB
1ComponentVolume
2LunaScript RT SuperMix (5X) 2 µL
3Template RNA 8 µL
4Total10 µL

AB
1ComponentVolume
2LunaScript RT SuperMix (5X) 2 µL
3Template RNA 8 µL
4Total10 µL

source.body: Viral RNA input from a clinical sample should be between Ct 18-35. If Ct is between 12-15, then dilute the sample 100-fold in water, if between 15-18 then dilute 10-fold in water. This will reduce the likelihood of PCR-inhibition.

To prevent pre-PCR contamination the mastermix should be added to the PCR strip-tubes/plate in the mastermix cabinet which should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.
RNA samples should be added in the extraction/sample addition cabinet which should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.body: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix can also be used instead of the component kit. Half-scale PCR reactions can also be used to save costs as you will only require for downstream steps.

To prevent pre-PCR contamination the mastermix for each pool should be made up in the mastermix cabinet which should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use and aliquoted into PCR strip-tubes/plate

source.description:
Add
cDNA to each of the PCR reactions, gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

source.body: Up to cDNA can be added to each PCR reaction (in place of nuclease-free water) to improve amplification of low titre samples. Using cDNA will require a cDNA reaction and may be more likely to cause inhibition so use cautiously.
cDNA should be added in the extraction and sample addition cabinet which should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description:
Set-up the following program on the thermal cycler:
Step Temperature Time Cycles
Heat Activation
1
Denaturation
25-35
Annealing
25-35
Hold
Indefinite 1

source.body: Cycle number should be 25 for Ct 18-21 up to a maximum of 35 cycles for Ct 35.

Thermocycler calibration can vary instrument to instrument. If you see amplicon 64 dropout then decrease the annealing/extension temperature to . Denaturation temperature of can also be used and may slightly increase PCR yields.

source.description:
Label strip-tubes/plate and combine the following volumes of each PCR reaction for
each sample:
AB

2Pool 1 PCR reaction2.5 µL
3Pool 2 PCR reaction2.5 µL
4Nuclease-free water45 µL
5Total50 µL

2Pool 1 PCR reaction2.5 µL

4Nuclease-free water45 µL
5Total50 µL

source.body: The PCR post-clean up concentration is typically around . This means we can pool them without quantification/normalisation to make a significant time saving. If you require very even barcode representation perform clean-up and normalise to then continue.
Amplicons should be added in the post-PCR cabinet which should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Barcode the amplicon pools using the one-pot native barcoding approach.

source.title: One-pot native barcoding of amplicons v3 (LoCost)
source.title_html: One-pot native barcoding of amplicons v3 (LoCost)
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9r429","text":"This one-pot native barcoding protocol was developed in conjunction with Oxford Nanopore Technologies, New England Biolabs and BCCDC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Quantify
of the barcoded amplicons using the Quantus Fluorometer using the ONE dsDNA assay. Concentration will vary depending on number and Ct of samples and but you need about
total at this stage to acheive maximum run yield.

source.title: DNA quantification using the Quantus fluorometer
source.article_citation: Fernández-Rodríguez A, Casas I, Culebras E, Morilla E, Cohen MC, Alberola J, COVID-19 and post-mortem microbiological studies. Spanish Journal of Legal Medicine doi: 10.1016/j.remle.2020.05.007

source.description: Set up the following AMII adapter ligation and clean-up with SFB.

source.title: Adapter ligation with AMII v2
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"qnlk","text":"This is a subprotocol for performing adapter ligation with AMII","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Quantify
of the final library using the Quantus Fluorometer using the ONE dsDNA assay. Concentration will vary depending on number and Ct of samples but
final library is usually required to acheive maximum run yield.

source.title: DNA quantification using the Quantus fluorometer
source.article_citation: Fernández-Rodríguez A, Casas I, Culebras E, Morilla E, Cohen MC, Alberola J, COVID-19 and post-mortem microbiological studies. Spanish Journal of Legal Medicine doi: 10.1016/j.remle.2020.05.007

source.body: Final library can be now be stored in Tris at for up to a week if needed otherwise proceed directly to MinION sequencing.

source.description:
Prime the flowcell and load
sequencing library onto the flowcell.

source.title: Priming and loading a MinION flowcell v2
source.title_html: Priming and loading a MinION flowcell v2

source.body: From experience we know is optimum loading input for short amplicons. Speed drop during the run indicates excessive library was loaded. Low run yield <20M reads indicates insufficient library.

source.description: Start the sequencing run using MinKNOW.

source.title: Starting a MinION sequencing run using MinKNOW
source.title_html: Starting a MinION sequencing run using MinKNOW
source.article_citation: Fernández-Rodríguez A, Casas I, Culebras E, Morilla E, Cohen MC, Alberola J, COVID-19 and post-mortem microbiological studies. Spanish Journal of Legal Medicine doi: 10.1016/j.remle.2020.05.007

source.body: If using Live basecalling ensure to turn on double-ended barcoding in the basecalling settings.

source.description:
If making up primer pools from individual oligos fully resuspend lyophilised oligos in 1xTE to a concentration of
, vortex thoroughly and spin down.

source.body: If using IDT ARTIC nCoV-2019 V3 Panel ( ) skip to step 6.

source.description:
Dilute
pools 1:10 in molecular grade water, to generate
primer stocks.

source.body: Primers are used at a final concentration of per primer. In this case V3 pools have 110 primers in pool 1 and 108 primers in pool 2. so the requirement is ~ primer pool ( ) per reaction.
Make up multiple aliquots of primer dilutions and freeze them in case of degradation or contamination.

source.description:
Sort all odd regions primers into one or more tube racks. Add
of each odd region primer to a
Eppendorf tube labelled "Pool 1 (
)". Repeat the process for all even region primers for Pool 2. These are your
stocks of each primer pool.

source.body: Primers should be diluted and pooled in the mastermix cabinet which should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

For more information see Figure 2 in;
Quick, J. et al. Multiplex PCR method for MinION and Illumina sequencing of Zika and other virus genomes directly from clinical samples. Nat Protoc 12, 1261–1276 (2017). https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2017.066

source.description: Prepare between 11 and 95 RNA samples plus 1 negative control of nuclease-free water per library. If previously frozen, mix by briefly vortexing and pulse spin to collect liquid. Keep samples on ice at all times.

source.body: At least 11 samples are required to have sufficient material to load on the sequencer at the end. If you process >23 you will need the EXP-NBD196 expansion kit.
A positive control can also be included which may be a synthetic RNA constructs or high-titre clinical sample which can be diluted. This can help monitor run performance.

description:
Amplicon sequencing protocol for SARS-CoV-2 v3 (LoCost)
We thank the ARTIC network, Oxford Nanopore Technologies, New England Biolabs, BCCDC, COG-UK, CanCOGen and protocols.io commenters for their assistance developing this protocol.
Changes in this version:
-Up to 95 samples per run with EXP-NBD196 native barcode kit
-Substitution of SuperScript IV for LunaScript RT SuperMix and reaction volume reduced to 10 uL.
-Substitution of Ultra II Ligation Module for Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix and reaction volume reduced to 10 µL.
-Native barcode ligation reaction volume reduced to 10 uL.
-SFB wash volume reduced.
